description: A horse-sized insect with digging claws and acidic blood.
name: Acid Burrower

features.name: Relentless (3)
features.description: The Burrower can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Earth Eruption
features.description: Mark a Stress to have the Burrower burst out of the ground. All creatures within Very Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or be knocked over, making them Vulnerable until they next act.

features.name: Spit Acid
features.description: Make an attack against all targets in front of the Burrower within Close range. Targets the Burrower succeeds against take 2d6 physical damage and must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Acid Bath
features.description: When the Burrower takes Severe damage, all creatures within Close range are bathed in their acidic blood, taking 1d10 physical damage. This splash covers the ground within Very Close range with blood, and all creatures other than the Burrower who move through it take 1d6 physical damage.

description: A winged insect the size of a large house with iridescent scales and wings that move too fast to track.
name: Adult Flickerfly

features.name: Relentless (4)
features.description: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to four times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Never Misses
features.description: When the Flickerfly makes an attack, the target’s Evasion is halved against the attack.

features.name: Deadly Flight
features.description: While flying, the Flickerfly can move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

features.name: Whirlwind
features.description: Spend a Fear to whirl, making an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Flickerfly succeeds against take 3d8 direct physical damage.

features.name: Mind Dance
features.description: Mark a Stress to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target’s fears.

features.name: Hallucinatory Breath
features.description: Countdown (Loop 1d6): When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must make an Instinct Reaction Roll or become overwhelmed by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail lose 2 Hope and take 3d8+3 direct magic damage.

features.name: Uncanny Reflexes
features.description: When the Flickerfly takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can mark a Stress to take half damage.

description: A young trainee eager to prove themselves.
name: Apprentice Assassin

features.name: Minion (6)
features.description: The Assassin is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Assassin, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Apprentice Assassins within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A decaying mage adorned in dark, tattered robes.
name: Arch-Necromancer

features.name: Dance of Death
features.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage, or full damage if you spend a Fear.

features.name: Beam of Decay
features.description: Mark 2 Stress to cause all targets within Far range to make a Strength Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d20+12 magic damage and you gain a Fear. Targets who succeed take half damage. A target who marks 2 or more HP must also mark 2 Stress and becomes Vulnerable until they roll with Hope.

features.name: Open the Gates of Death
features.description: Spend a Fear to summon a Zombie Legion, which appears at Close range and immediately takes the spotlight.

features.name: Not Today, My Dears
features.description: When the Necromancer has marked 7 or more of their HP, you can spend a Fear to have them teleport away to a safe location to recover. A PC who succeeds on an Instinct Roll can trace the teleportation magic to their destination.

features.name: Your Demise is Near
features.description: Countdown (2d6). When the Necromancer has marked 6 or more of their HP, activate the countdown. When it triggers, deal 2d10+6 direct magic damage to a target within Close range. The Necromancer then clears a number of Stress or HP equal to the number of HP marked by the target from this attack.

description: A tall guard bearing a longbow and quiver with arrows fletched in the settlement’s colors.
name: Archer Guard

features.name: Hobbling Shot
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 1d12+3 physical damage. If the target marks HP from this attack, they have disadvantage on Agility Rolls until they clear at least 1 HP.

description: A group of trained archers bearing massive bows.
name: Archer Squadron

features.name: Horde (1d6+3)
features.description: When the Squadron has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d6+3 physical damage instead.

features.name: Focused Volley
features.description: Spend a Fear to target a point within Far range. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Close range of that point. Targets the Squadron succeeds against take 1d10+4 physical damage.

features.name: Suppressing Fire
features.description: Mark a Stress to target a point within Far range. Until the next roll with Fear, a creature who moves within Close range of that point must make an Agility Reaction Roll. On a failure, they take 2d6+3 physical damage. On a success, they take half damage.

description: A cunning scoundrel skilled in both poisons and ambushing.
name: Assassin Poisoner

features.name: Grindeloth Venom
features.description: Targets who mark HP from the Assassin’s attacks are Vulnerable until they clear a HP.

features.name: Out of Nowhere
features.description: The Assassin has advantage on attacks if they are Hidden.

features.name: Fumigation
features.description: Drop a smoke bomb that fills the air within Close range with smoke, Dizzilying all targets in this area. Dizzied targets have disadvantage on their next action roll, then clear the condition.

description: A cube-shaped construct with a different rune on each of their six sides.
name: Battle Box

features.name: Relentless (2)
features.description: The Box can be spotlighted up to two times per turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Randomized Tactics
features.description: Mark a Stress and roll a d6. The Box uses the corresponding move: 1. Mana Beam: The Box fires a searing beam. Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 magic damage. 2. Fire Jets: The Box shoots into the air, spinning and releasing jets of flame. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take 2d8 physical damage. 3. Trample: The Box rockets around erratically. Make an attack against all PCs within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take 1d6+5 physical damage and are Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. 4. Shocking Gas: The Box sprays out a silver gas sparking with lightning. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll or mark 3 Stress. 5. Stunning Clap: The Box leaps and their sides clap, creating a concussive boom. All targets within Very Close range must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll or become Vulnerable until the cube is defeated. 6. Psonic Whine: The Box releases a cluster of mechanical bees whose buzz rattles mortal minds. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll or take 2d4+9 direct magic damage.

features.name: Overcharge
features.description: Before rolling damage for the Box’s attack, you can mark a Stress to add a d6 to the damage roll. Additionally, you gain a Fear.

features.name: Death Quake
features.description: When the Box marks their last HP, the magic powering them ruptures in an explosion of force. All targets within Close range must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or take 2d8+1 magic damage.

description: A large bear with thick fur and powerful claws.
name: Bear

features.name: Overwhelming Force
features.description: Targets who mark HP from the Bear’s standard attack are knocked back to Very Close range.

features.name: Bite
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 3d4+10 physical damage and the target is Restrained until they break free with a successful Strength Roll.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Bear makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: An armored guard bearing a sword and shield painted in the settlement’s colors.
name: Bladed Guard

features.name: Shield Wall
features.description: A creature who tries to move within Very Close range of the Guard must succeed on an Agility Roll. If additional Bladed Guards are standing in a line alongside the first, and each is within Melee range of another guard in the line, the Difficulty increases by the total number of guards in the line.

features.name: Detain
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to Restrain the target until they break free with a successful attack, Finesse Roll, or Strength Roll.

description: A large corpse, decay-bloated and angry.
name: Brawny Zombie

features.name: Slow
features.description: When you spotlight the Zombie and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Zombie and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Rend Asunder
features.description: Make a standard attack with advantage against a target the Zombie has Restrained. On a success, the attack deals direct damage.

features.name: Rip and Tear
features.description: When the Zombies makes a successful standard attack, you can mark a Stress to temporarily Restrain the target and force them to mark 2 Stress.

description: A massive humanoid who sees all sapient life as food.
name: Cave Ogre

features.name: Ramp Up
features.description: You must spend a Fear to spotlight the Ogre. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

features.name: Bone Breaker
features.description: The Ogre’s attacks deal direct damage.

features.name: Hail of Boulders
features.description: Mark a Stress to pick up heavy objects and throw them at all targets in front of the Ogre within Far range. Make an attack against these targets. Targets the Ogre succeeds against take 1d10+2 physical damage. If they succeed against more than one target, you gain a Fear.

features.name: Rampaging Fury
features.description: When the Ogre marks 2 or more HP, they can rampage. Move the Ogre to a point within Close range and deal 2d6+3 direct physical damage to all targets in their path.

description: A floating humanoid skull animated by scintillating magic.
name: Chaos Skull

features.name: Levitation
features.description: The Skull levitates several feet off the ground and can’t be Restrained.

features.name: Wards
features.description: The Skull is resistant to magic damage.

features.name: Magic Burst
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Skull succeeds against take 2d6+4 magic damage.

features.name: Siphon Magic
features.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a PC with a Spellcast trait within Very Close range. On a success, the target marks 1d4 Stress and the Skull clears that many Stress. Additionally, on a success, the Skull can immediately be spotlighted again.

description: A poorly trained civilian pressed into war.
name: Conscript

features.name: Minion (6)
features.description: The Conscript is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Conscript, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Conscripts within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 6 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A roughly humanoid being of stone and steel, assembled and animated by magic.
name: Construct

features.name: Relentless (2)
features.description: The Construct can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Weak Structure
features.description: When the Construct marks HP from physical damage, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Trample
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets in the Construct’s path when they move. Targets the Construct succeeds against take 1d8 physical damage.

features.name: Overload
features.description: Before rolling damage for the Construct’s attack, you can mark a Stress to gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll. The Construct can then take the spotlight again.

features.name: Death Quake
features.description: When the Construct marks their last HP, the magic powering them ruptures in an explosion of force. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Construct succeeds against take 1d12+2 magic damage.

description: An accomplished manipulator and master of the social arts.
name: Courtesan

features.name: Searing Glance
features.description: When a PC within Close range makes a Presence Roll, you can mark a Stress to cast a gaze toward the aftermath. On the target’s failure, they must mark 2 Stress and are Vulnerable until the scene ends or they succeed on a social action against the Courtesan. On the target’s success, they must mark a Stress.

description: An ambitious and ostentatiously dressed socialite.
name: Courtier

features.name: Mockery
features.description: Mark a Stress to say something mocking and force a target within Close range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (14) to see if they can save face. On a failure, the target must mark 2 Stress and is Vulnerable until the scene ends.

features.name: Scapegoat
features.description: Spend a Fear and target a PC. The Courtier convinces a crowd or prominent individual that the target is the cause of their current conflict or misfortune.

description: An experienced mage wielding shadow and fear.
name: Cult Adept

features.name: Enervating Blast
features.description: Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target within range. On a success, the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Shroud of the Fallen
features.description: Mark a Stress to wrap an ally within Close range in a shroud of Protection until the Adept marks their last HP. While Protected, the target has resistance to all damage.

features.name: Shadow Shackles
features.description: Spend a Fear and choose a point within Far range. All targets within Close range of that point are Restrained in smoky chains until they break free with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll. A target Restrained by this feature must spend a Hope to make an action roll.

features.name: Fear Is Fuel
features.description: Twice per scene, when a PC rolls a failure with Fear, clear a Stress.

description: A professional killer-turned-cultist.
name: Cult Fang

features.name: Shadow’s Embrace
features.description: The Fang can climb and walk on vertical surfaces. Mark a Stress to move from one shadow to another within Far range.

features.name: Pick Off the Straggler
features.description: Mark a Stress to cause a target within Melee range to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target must mark 2 Stress and is teleported with the Fang to a shadow within Far range, making them temporarily Vulnerable. On a success, the target must mark a Stress.

description: A low-ranking cultist in simple robes, eager to gain power.
name: Cult Initiate

features.name: Minion (6)
features.description: The Initiate is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Initiate, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Cult Initiates within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A burly vegetable-person with grasping vines.
name: Deeproot Defender

features.name: Ground Slam
features.description: Slam the ground, knocking all targets within Very Close range back to Far range. Each target knocked back by this must mark a Stress.

features.name: Grab and Drag
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Close range. On a success, spend a Fear to pull them into Melee range, deal 1d6+2 physical damage, and Restrain them until the Defender takes Severe damage.

description: A regal cloaked monstrosity with circular horns adorned with treasure.
name: Demon Of Avarice

features.name: Money Talks
features.description: Attacks against the Demon are made with disadvantage unless the attacker spends a handful of gold. This Demon starts with a number of handfuls equal to the number of PCs. When a target marks HP from the Demon’s standard attack, they can spend a handful of gold instead of marking HP (1 handful per HP). Add a handful of gold to the Demon for each handful of gold spent by PCs on this feature.

features.name: Numbers Must Go Up
features.description: Add a bonus to the Demon’s attack rolls equal to the number of handfuls of gold they have.

features.name: Money is Time
features.description: Spend 3 handfuls of gold (or a Fear) to spotlight 1d4+1 allies.

description: A cloaked one-creature with long limbs, seeping shadows.
name: Demon Of Despair

features.name: Depths of Despair
features.description: The Demon deals double damage to PCs with 0 Hope.

features.name: Your Struggle Is Pointless
features.description: Spend a Fear to weigh down the spirits of all PCs within Far range. All targets affected replace their Hope Die with a d8 until they roll a success with Hope or their next rest.

features.name: Your Friends Will Fail You
features.description: When a PC fails with Fear, you can mark a Stress to cause all other PCs within Close range to lose a Hope.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Demon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A perfectly beautiful and infinitely cruel demon with a gleaming spear and elegant robes.
name: Demon Of Hubris

features.name: Terrifying
features.description: When the Demon makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range must lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Double or Nothing
features.description: When a PC within Far range fails a roll, they can choose to reroll their Fear Die and take the new result. If they still fail, they mark 2 Stress and the Demon clears a Stress.

features.name: Unparalleled Skill
features.description: Mark a Stress to deal the Demon’s standard attack damage to a target within Close range.

features.name: The Root of Villainy
features.description: Spend a Fear to spotlight two other Demons within Far range.

features.name: You Pale in Comparison
features.description: When a PC fails a roll within Close range of the Demon, they must mark a Stress.

description: A fickle creature of spindly limbs and insatiable desires.
name: Demon Of Jealousy

features.name: Unprotected Mind
features.description: The Demon’s standard attack deals direct damage.

features.name: My Turn
features.description: When the Demon marks HP from an attack, spend a number of Fear equal to the HP marked by the Demon to cause the attacker to mark the same number of HP.

features.name: Rivalry
features.description: When a creature within Close range takes damage from a different adversary, you can mark a Stress to add a d4 to the damage roll.

features.name: What’s Yours Is Mine
features.description: When a PC takes severe damage within Very Close range of the Demon, you can spend a Fear to cause the target to make a Finesse Reaction Roll. On a failure, the Demon seizes one item or consumable of their choice from the target’s inventory.

description: A hulking demon with boulder-sized fists, driven by endless rage.
name: Demon Of Wrath

features.name: Anger Unrelenting
features.description: The Demon’s attacks deal direct damage.

features.name: Battle Lust
features.description: Spend a Fear to boil the blood of all PCs within Far range. They use a d20 as their Fear Die until the end of the scene.

features.name: Retaliation
features.description: When the Demon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can mark a Stress to make a standard attack against the attacker.

features.name: Blood and Souls
features.description: Countdown (Loop 6): Activate the first time an attack is made within sight of the Demon. It ticks down when a PC takes a violent action. When it triggers, summon 1d4 Minor Demons, who appear at Close range.

description: Unnatural hounds lit from within by hellfire.
name: Demonic Hound Pack

features.name: Horde (2d4+1)
features.description: When the Pack has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 2d4+1 physical damage instead.

features.name: Dreadhowl
features.description: Mark a Stress to make all targets within Very Close range lose a Hope. If a target is not able to lose a Hope, they must instead mark 2 Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Pack makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A winged pet endlessly loyal to their vampire owner.
name: Dire Bat

features.name: Flying
features.description: While flying, the Bat gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

features.name: Screech
features.description: Mark a Stress to send a high-pitch screech out toward all targets in front of the Bat within Far range. Those targets must mark 1d4 Stress.

features.name: Guardian
features.description: When an allied Vampire marks HP, you can mark a Stress to fly into Melee range of the attacker and make an attack with advantage against them. On a success, deal 2d6+2 physical damage.

description: A large wolf with menacing teeth, seldom encountered alone.
name: Dire Wolf

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: If the Wolf makes a successful standard attack and another Dire Wolf is within Melee range of the target, deal 1d6+5 physical damage instead of their standard damage and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Hobbling Strike
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 3d4+10 direct physical damage and make them Vulnerable until they clear at least 1 HP.

description: A nature spirit in the form of a humanoid tree.
name: Dryad

features.name: Bramble Patch
features.description: Mark a Stress to target a point within Far range. Create a patch of thorns that covers an area within Close range of that point. All targets within that area take 2d6+2 physical damage when they act. A target must succeed on a Finesse Roll or take more than 20 damage to the Dryad with an attack to leave the area.

features.name: Group Saplings
features.description: Spend a Fear to grow three Treant Sapling Minions, who appear at Close range and immediately take the spotlight.

features.name: We Are All One
features.description: When an ally dies within Close range, you can spend a Fear to clear 2 HP and 2 Stress as the fallen ally’s life force is returned to the forest.

description: A swarm of eels that encircle and electrocute.
name: Electric Eels

features.name: Horde (2d4+1)
features.description: When the Eels have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 2d4+1 physical damage instead.

features.name: Paralyzing Shock
features.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. You gain a Fear for each target that marks HP.

description: A blazing mote of elemental fire.
name: Elemental Spark

features.name: Minion (9)
features.description: The Elemental is defeated when they take any damage. For every 9 damage a PC deals to the Elemental, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Elemental Sparks within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: An armored squire or experienced commoner looking to advance.
name: Elite Soldier

features.name: Reinforce
features.description: Mark a Stress to move into Melee range of an ally and make a standard attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 physical damage and the ally can clear a Stress.

features.name: Vassal’s Loyalty
features.description: When the Soldier is within Very Close range of a knight or other noble who would take damage, you can mark a Stress to move into Melee range of them and take the damage instead.

description: A magical necromantic experiment gone wrong, leaving them warped and ungainly.
name: Failed Experiment

features.name: Warped Fortitude
features.description: The Experiment is resistant to physical damage.

features.name: Overwhelm
features.description: When a target the Experiment attacks has other adversaries within Very Close range, the Experiment deals double damage.

features.name: Lurching Lunge
features.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight the Experiment as an additional GM move instead of spending Fear.

description: A cursed soul bound to the Fallen’s will.
name: Fallen Shock Troop

features.name: Minion (12)
features.description: The Shock Troop is defeated when they take any damage. For every 12 damage a PC deals to the Shock Troop, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Aura of Doom
features.description: When a PC marks HP from an attack by the Shock Troop, they lose a Hope.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Fallen Shock Troops within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 12 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: Warped mage bound by the bargains they made in life.
name: Fallen Sorcerer

features.name: Conflagration
features.description: Spend a Fear to unleash an all-consuming firestorm and make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Sorcerer succeeds against take 2d10+6 direct magic damage.

features.name: Nightmare Tableau
features.description: Mark a Stress to trap a target within Far range in a powerful illusion of their worst fears. While trapped, the target is Restrained and Vulnerable until they break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Instinct Roll.

features.name: Slippery
features.description: When the Sorcerer takes damage from an attack, they can teleport up to Far range.

features.name: Shackles of Guilt
features.description: Countdown (Loop 2d6). When the Sorcerer is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, all targets within Far range become Vulnerable and must mark a Stress as they relive their greatest regrets. A target can break free from their regret with a successful Presence or Strength Roll. When a PC fails to break free, they lose a Hope.

description: A fallen God, wreathed in rage and resentment, bearing millennia of experience in breaking heroes’ spirits.
name: Fallen Warlord: Realm-Breaker

features.name: Relentless (2)
features.description: The Realm-Breaker can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Firespite Plate Armor
features.description: When the Realm-Breaker takes damage, reduce it by 2d10.

features.name: Tormenting Lash
features.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. When a target uses armor to reduce damage from this attack, they must mark 2 Armor Slots.

features.name: All
features.description: Countdown (Decreasing 8). When the Realm-Breaker is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, create a torrent of incarnate rage that rends flesh from bone. All targets within Far range must make a Presence Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d6+10 direct magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage. For each HP marked from this damage, summon a Fallen Shock Troop within Very Close range of the target who marked that HP. If the countdown ever decreases its maximum value to 0, the Realm-Breaker marks their remaining HP and all targets within Far range must mark all remaining HP and make a death move.

features.name: Doombringer
features.description: When a target marks HP from an attack by the Realm-Breaker, all PCs within Far range of the target must lose a Hope.

features.name: I Have Never Known Defeat (Phase Change)
features.description: When the Realm-Breaker marks their last HP, replace them with the Undefeated Champion and immediately spotlight them.

description: That which only the most feared have a chance to fear.
name: Fallen Warlord: Undefeated Champion

features.name: Relentless (3)
features.description: The Undefeated Champion can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Faltering Armor
features.description: When the Undefeated Champion takes damage, reduce it by 1d10.

features.name: Shattering Strike
features.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. PCs the Champion succeeds against lose a number of Hope equal to the HP they marked from this attack.

features.name: Endless Legions
features.description: Spend a Fear to summon a number of Fallen Shock Troops equal to twice the number of PCs. The Shock Troops appear at Far range.

features.name: Circle of Defilement
features.description: Countdown (1d8). When the Undefeated Champion is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, activate a magical circle covering an area within Far range of the Champion. A target within that area is Vulnerable until they leave the circle. The circle can be removed by dealing Severe damage to the Undefeated Champion.

features.name: Doombringer
features.description: When the Undefeated Champion makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

features.name: Doombringer
features.description: When a target marks HP from an attack by the Undefeated Champion, all PCs within Far range of the target lose a Hope.

description: A leather-clad warrior bearing a whip and massive bow.
name: Giant Beastmaster

features.name: Two as One
features.description: When the Beastmaster is spotlighted, you can also spotlight a Tier 1 animal adversary currently under their control.

features.name: Pinning Strike
features.description: Make a standard attack against a target. On a success, you can mark a Stress to pin them to a nearby surface. The pinned target is Restrained until they break free with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll.

features.name: Deadly Companion
features.description: Twice per scene, summon a Bear, Dire Wolf, or similar Tier 1 animal adversary under the Beastmaster’s control. The adversary appears at Close range and is immediately spotlighted.

description: An especially muscular giant wielding a warhammer larger than a human.
name: Giant Brawler

features.name: Battering Ram
features.description: Mark a Stress to have the Brawler charge at an inanimate object within Close range they could feasibly smash (such as a wall, cart, or market stand) and destroy it. All targets within Very Close range of the object must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 2d4+3 physical damage from the shrapnel.

features.name: Bloody Reprisal
features.description: When the Brawler marks 2 or more HP from an attack within Very Close range, you can make a standard attack against the attacker. On a success, the Brawler deals 2d6+15 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Brawler makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A giant bird of prey with blood-stained talons.
name: Giant Eagle

features.name: Flight
features.description: While flying, the Eagle gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

features.name: Deadly Dive
features.description: Mark a Stress to attack a target within Far range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 physical damage and knock the target over, making them Vulnerable until they next act.

features.name: Take Off
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d4+3 physical damage and the target must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or become temporarily Restrained within the Eagle’s massive talons. If the target is Restrained, the Eagle immediately lifts them to the air to Very Far range above the battlefield while holding them.

features.name: Deadly Drop
features.description: While flying, the Eagle can drop a Restrained target they are holding. When dropped, the target is no longer Restrained but starts falling. If their fall isn’t prevented during the PCs’ next action, the target takes 2d20 physical damage when they land.

description: Dozens of fist-sized mosquitoes, flying together for protection.
name: Giant Mosquitoes

features.name: Horde (1d4+1)
features.description: When the Mosquitoes have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

features.name: Flying
features.description: While flying, the Mosquitoes have a +2 bonus to their Difficulty.

features.name: Bloodseeker
features.description: When the Mosquitoes’ attack causes a target to mark HP, you can mark a Stress to force the target to mark an additional HP.

description: A cat-sized rodent skilled at scavenging and survival.
name: Giant Rat

features.name: Minion (3)
features.description: The Rat is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Rat, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Giant Rats within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 1 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A giant fighter undergoing borrowed armor.
name: Giant Recruit

features.name: Minion (7)
features.description: The Recruit is defeated when they take any damage. For every 7 damage a PC deals to the Recruit, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Giant Recruits within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A human-sized insect with tearing claws and a stinging tail.
name: Giant Scorpion

features.name: Double Strike
features.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against two targets within Melee range.

features.name: Venomous Stinger
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, spend a Fear to deal 1d4+4 physical damage and Poison them until their next rest or they succeed on a Knowledge Roll (16). While Poisoned, the target must roll a d6 before they make an action roll. On a result of 4 or lower, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Scorpion makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A clear serpent with a massive head that leaves behind a glass shard trail wherever they go.
name: Glass Snake

features.name: Armor
features.description: On a successful attack within Melee range against the Snake, the attacker must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Spinning Serpent
features.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Snake succeeds against take 1d6+1 physical damage.

features.name: Spitter
features.description: Spend a Fear to introduce a 6 Spitter Die. When the Snake is in the spotlight, roll this die. On a result of 5 or higher, all targets in front of the Snake within Far range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 1d4 physical damage. The Snake can take the spotlight a second time this GM turn.

description: A snake-headed, scaled humanoid with a gilded bow, enraged that their peace has been disturbed.
name: Gorgon

features.name: Relentless (2)
features.description: The Gorgon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Suneater Arrows
features.description: When the Gorgon makes a successful standard attack, the target Glows until the end of the scene and can’t become Hidden. Attack rolls made against a Glowing target have advantage.

features.name: Crown of Serpents
features.description: Make an attack roll against a target within Melee range using the Gorgon’s protective snakes. On a success, mark Stress to deal 2d10+4 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Petrifying Gaze
features.description: When the Gorgon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can spend a Fear to force the attacker to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, they begin to turn to stone, marking a HP and starting a Petrification Countdown (4). This countdown ticks down when the Gorgon is attacked. When it triggers, the target must make a death move. If the Gorgon is defeated, all petrification countdowns end.

features.name: Death Glare
features.description: When the Gorgon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A living landslide of boulders and dust, as large as a house.
name: Greater Earth Elemental

features.name: Slow
features.description: When you spotlight the Elemental and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Elemental and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Crushing Blows
features.description: When the Elemental makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Immovable Object
features.description: An attack that would move the Elemental moves them two fewer ranges (for example, Far becomes Very Close). When the Elemental takes physical damage, reduce it by 7.

features.name: Rockslide
features.description: Mark a Stress to create a rockslide that buries all the land in front of Elemental within Close range with rockfall. All targets in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (19). Targets who fail take 2d12+5 physical damage and become Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A huge living wave that crashes down upon enemies.
name: Greater Water Elemental

features.name: Water Jet
features.description: Mark a Stress to attack a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d4+7 physical damage and the target’s next action has disadvantage. On a failure, the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Drowning Embrace
features.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against become Restrained and Vulnerable as they begin drowning. A target can break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll.

features.name: High Tide
features.description: When the Elemental makes a successful standard attack, you can mark a Stress to knock the target back to Close range.

description: A moving mound of translucent green slime.
name: Green Ooze

features.name: Slow
features.description: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Acidic Form
features.description: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Envelope
features.description: Make a standard attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. The target must mark an additional Stress when they make an action roll. If the Ooze takes Severe damage, the target is freed.

features.name: Split
features.description: When the Ooze has 3 or more HP marked, you can spend a Fear to split them into two Tiny Green Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

description: Spirit soldiers with sanctified bows.
name: Hallowed Archer

features.name: Punish the Guilty
features.description: The Archer deals double damage to targets marked Guilty by a High Seraph.

features.name: Divine Volley
features.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against up to three targets.

description: Souls of the faithful, lifted up with divine weaponry.
name: Hallowed Soldier

features.name: Minion (13)
features.description: The Soldier is defeated when they take any damage. For every 13 damage a PC deals to the Soldier, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Divine Flight
features.description: While the Soldier is flying, spend a Fear to move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Hallowed Soldiers within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 10 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A nimble fighter armed with javelins.
name: Harrier

features.name: Maintain Distance
features.description: After making a standard attack, the Harrier can move anywhere within Far range.

features.name: Fall Back
features.description: When a creature moves into Melee range to make an attack, you can mark a Stress before the attack roll to move anywhere within Close range and make an attack against that creature. On a success, deal 1d10+2 physical damage.

description: A seasoned guard with a mace, a whistle, and a bellowing voice.
name: Head Guard

features.name: Rally Guards
features.description: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight the Head Guard and up to 2d4 allies within Far range.

features.name: On My Signal
features.description: Countdown (5). When the Head Guard is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. It ticks down when a PC makes an attack roll. When it triggers, all Archer Guards within Far range make a standard attack with advantage against the nearest target within their range. If any attacks succeed on the same target, combine their damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Head Guard makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A captivating undead dressed in aristocratic finery.
name: Head Vampire

features.name: Terrifying
features.description: When the Vampire makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Look Into My Eyes
features.description: A creature who moves into Melee range of the Vampire must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, you gain 1d4 Fear.

features.name: Feed on Followers
features.description: When the Vampire is within Melee range of an ally, they can cause the ally to mark a HP. The Vampire then clears a HP.

features.name: The Hunt Is On
features.description: Spend 2 Fear to summon 1d4 Vampires, who appear at Far range and immediately take the spotlight.

features.name: Lifesuck
features.description: When the Vampire is spotlighted, roll a d8. On a result of 6 or higher, all targets within Very Close range must mark a HP.

description: A divine champion, head of a hallowed host of warriors who enforce their god’s will.
name: High Seraph

features.name: Relentless (2)
features.description: The Seraph can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Divine Flight
features.description: While the Seraph is flying, spend a Fear to move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

features.name: Judgment
features.description: Spend a Fear to make a target Guilty in the eyes of the Seraph’s god until the Seraph is defeated. While Guilty, the target doesn’t gain Hope on a result with Hope. When the Seraph succeeds on a standard attack against a Guilty target, they deal Severe damage instead of their standard damage. The Seraph can only mark one target at a time.

features.name: God Rays
features.description: Mark a Stress to reflect a sliver of divinity as a searing beam of light that hits up to twenty targets within Very Far range. Targets must make a Presence Reaction Roll, with disadvantage if they are marked Guilty. Targets who fail take 4d6+12 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: We Are One
features.description: Once per scene, spend a Fear to spotlight all other adversaries within Far range. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

description: A translucent green mound of acid taller than most humans.
name: Huge Green Ooze

features.name: Slow
features.description: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

features.name: Acidic Form
features.description: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Envelop
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze Envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. While Enveloped, the target must mark an additional Stress every time they make an action roll. When the Ooze takes Severe damage, all Enveloped targets are freed and the condition is cleared.

features.name: Split
features.description: When the Ooze has 4 or more HP marked, you can spend a Fear to split them into two Green Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

description: A quadrupedal scaled beast with multiple long-necked heads, each filled with menacing fangs.
name: Hydra

features.name: Many
features.description: The Hydra begins with three heads and can have up to five. When the Hydra takes Major or greater damage, they lose a head.

features.name: Relentless (X)
features.description: The Hydra can be spotlighted X times per GM turn, where X is the Hydra’s number of heads. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Regeneration
features.description: If the Hydra has any marked HP, spend a Fear to clear a HP and grow two heads.

features.name: Terrifying Chorus
features.description: All PCs within Far range lose 2 Hope.

features.name: Magical Weakness
features.description: When the Hydra takes magic damage, they become Dazed until the next roll with Fear. While Dazed, they can’t use their Regeneration action but are immune to magic damage.

description: A cunning criminal in a cloak bearing one of the gang’s iconic knives.
name: Jagged Knife Bandit

features.name: Climber
features.description: The Bandit climbs just as easily as they run.

features.name: From Above
features.description: When the Bandit succeeds on a standard attack from above a target, they deal 1d10+1 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

description: A staff-wielding bandit in a cloak adorned with magical paraphernalia, using curses to vex their foes.
name: Jagged Knife Hexer

features.name: Curse
features.description: Choose a target within Far range and temporarily Curse them. While the target is Cursed, you can mark a Stress so that target rolls with Hope to make the roll be with Fear instead.

features.name: Chaotic Flux
features.description: Make an attack against up to three targets within Very Close range. Mark a Stress to deal 2d6+3 magic damage to targets the Hexer succeeded against.

description: An imposing brawler carrying a large club.
name: Jagged Knife Kneebreaker

features.name: I’ve Got ‘Em
features.description: Creatures Restrained by the Kneebreaker take double damage from attacks by other adversaries.

features.name: Hold Them Down
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the target takes no damage but is Restrained and Vulnerable. The target can break free, clearing both conditions, with a successful Strength Roll or is freed automatically if the Kneebreaker takes Major or greater damage.

description: A thief with simple clothes and small daggers, eager to prove themselves.
name: Jagged Knife Lackey

features.name: Minion (3)
features.description: The Lackey is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Lackey, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Jagged Knife Lackeys within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A seasoned bandit in quality leathers with a strong voice and cunning eyes.
name: Jagged Knife Lieutenant

features.name: Tactician
features.description: When you spotlight the Lieutenant, mark a Stress to also spotlight two allies within Close range.

features.name: More Where That Came From
features.description: Summon three Jagged Knife Lackeys, who appear at Far range.

features.name: Coup de Grace
features.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Close range. On a success, deal 2d6+12 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Lieutenant makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A nimble scoundrel bearing a wicked knife and utilizing shadow magic to isolate targets.
name: Jagged Knife Shadow

features.name: Backstab
features.description: When the Shadow succeeds on a standard attack that has advantage, they deal 1d6+6 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Cloaked
features.description: Become Hidden until after the Shadow’s next attack. Attacks made while Hidden from this feature have advantage.

description: A lanky bandit striking from cover with a shortbow.
name: Jagged Knife Sniper

features.name: Unseen Strike
features.description: If the Sniper is Hidden when they make a successful standard attack against a target, they deal 1d10+4 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

description: A horse-sized insect with iridescent scales and crystalline wings moving faster than the eye can see.
name: Juvenile Flickerfly

features.name: Relentless (3)
features.description: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Peerless Accuracy
features.description: Before the Flickerfly makes an attack, roll a d6. On a result of 4 or higher, the target’s Evasion is halved against this attack.

features.name: Mind Dance
features.description: Mark a Stress to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target’s fears.

features.name: Hallucinatory Breath
features.description: Countdown (Loop 1d6): When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or be tormented by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail must mark a Stress and lose a Hope.

description: A decorated soldier with heavy armor and a powerful steed.
name: Knight Of The Realm

features.name: Chevalier
features.description: While the Knight is on a mount, they gain a +2 bonus to their Difficulty. When they take Severe damage, they’re knocked from their mount and lose this benefit until they’re next spotlighted.

features.name: Heavily Armored
features.description: When the Knight takes physical damage, reduce it by 3.

features.name: Cavalry Charge
features.description: If the Knight is mounted, move up to Far range and make a standard attack against a target. On a success, deal 2d8+4 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

features.name: For the Realm!
features.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4+1 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

description: A legendary beast of the sea, bigger than the largest galleon, with sucker-laden tentacles and a terrifying maw.
name: Kraken

features.name: Relentless (3)
features.description: The Kraken can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Many Tentacles
features.description: While the Kraken has 7 or fewer marked HP, they can make their standard attack against two targets within range.

features.name: Grapple and Drown
features.description: Make an attack roll against a target within Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to grab them with a tentacle and drag them beneath the water. The target is Restrained and Vulnerable until they break free with a successful Strength Roll or the Kraken takes Major or greater damage. While Restrained and Vulnerable in this way, a target must mark a Stress when they make an action roll.

features.name: Boiling Blast
features.description: Spend a Fear to spew a line of boiling water at any number of targets in a line up to Far range. All targets must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 4d6+9 physical damage. If a target marks an Armor Slot to reduce the damage, they must also mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Kraken makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A cunning thief with acrobatic skill and a flair for the dramatic.
name: Masked Thief

features.name: Quick Hands
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 1d8+2 physical damage and the Thief steals one item or consumable from the target’s inventory.

features.name: Escape Plan
features.description: Mark a Stress to reveal a snare trap set anywhere on the battlefield by the Thief. All targets within Very Close range of the trap must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be pulled off their feet and suspended upside down. The target is Restrained and Vulnerable until they break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll (13).

description: A seasoned killer with a threatening voice and a deadly blade.
name: Master Assassin

features.name: Won’t See It Coming
features.description: The Assassin deals direct damage while they’re Hidden.

features.name: Strike as One
features.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight a number of other Assassins equal to the Assassin’s unmarked Stress.

features.name: The Subtle Blade
features.description: When the Assassin successfully makes a standard attack against a Vulnerable target, you can spend a Fear to deal Severe damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Assassin makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: An accomplished merchant with a large operation under their command.
name: Merchant Baron

features.name: Everyone Has a Price
features.description: Spend a Fear to offer a target a dangerous bargain for something they want or need. If used on a PC, they must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failure, they must mark 2 Stress or take the deal.

features.name: The Best Muscle Money Can Buy
features.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon 1d4+1 Tier 1 adversaries, who appear at Far range, to enforce the Baron’s will.

description: A finely dressed trader with a keen eye for financial gain.
name: Merchant

features.name: Preferential Treatment
features.description: A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll against the Merchant gains a discount on purchases. A PC who fails on a Presence Roll against the Merchant must pay more and has disadvantage on future Presence Rolls against the Merchant.

features.name: The Runaround
features.description: When a PC rolls a 14 or lower on a Presence Roll made against the Merchant, they must mark a Stress.

description: A coruscating mass of uncontrollable magic.
name: Minor Chaos Elemental

features.name: Arcane Master
features.description: The Elemental is resistant to magic damage.

features.name: Sickening Flux
features.description: Mark a HP to force all targets within Close range to mark a Stress and become Vulnerable until their next rest or they clear a HP.

features.name: Remake Reality
features.description: Spend a Fear to transform the area within Very Close range into a different biome. All targets within this area take 2d6+3 direct magic damage.

features.name: Magical Reflection
features.description: When the Elemental takes damage from an attack within Close range, deal an amount of damage to the attacker equal to half of the damage they dealt.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A crimson-hued creature from the Circles Below, consumed by rage against all mortals.
name: Minor Demon

features.name: Relentless (2)
features.description: The Demon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: All Must Fall
features.description: When a PC rolls a failure with Fear while within Close range of the Demon, they lose a Hope.

features.name: Hellfire
features.description: Spend a Fear to rain down hellfire within Far range. All targets within the area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 1d20+3 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Reaper
features.description: Before rolling damage for the Demon’s attack, you can mark a Stress to gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to the Demon’s current number of marked HP.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Demon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: A living flame the size of a large bonfire.
name: Minor Fire Elemental

features.name: Relentless (2)
features.description: The Elemental can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

features.name: Scorched Earth
features.description: Mark a Stress to choose a point within Far range. The ground within Very Close range of that point immediately bursts into flames. All creatures within this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d8 magic damage from the flames. Targets who succeed take half damage.

features.name: Explosion
features.description: Spend a Fear to erupt in a fiery explosion. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against take 1d8 magic damage and are knocked back to Far range.

features.name: Consume Kindling
features.description: Three times per scene, when the Elemental moves on objects that are highly flammable, consume them to clear a HP or a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: An ambulatory sapling rising up to defend their forest.
name: Minor Treant

features.name: Minion (5)
features.description: The Treant is defeated when they take any damage. For every 5 damage a PC deals to the Treant, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Minor Treants within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A massive bull-headed hybrid with a quick temper.
name: Minotaur Wrecker

features.name: Ramp Up
features.description: You must spend a Fear to spotlight the Minotaur. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

features.name: Charging Bull
features.description: Mark a Stress to charge through a group within Close range and make an attack against all targets in the Minotaur’s path. Targets the Minotaur succeeds against take 2d6+8 physical damage and are knocked back to Very Far range. If a target is knocked into a solid object or another creature, they take an extra 1d6 damage (combine their damage).

features.name: Gore
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range, moving the Minotaur into Melee range of them. On a success, deal 2d8 direct physical damage.

description: The sovereign ruler of a nation, unearthed in the privilege of tradition and wielding unmatched power in their domain.
name: Monarch

features.name: Execute Them!
features.description: Spend a Fear per PC in the party to have the group condemned for crimes real or imagined. A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll can demand trial by combat or another special form of trial.

features.name: Crossguard
features.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon Tier X Minions, who appear at Close range to enforce the Monarch’s will.

features.name: Census Bell
features.description: Long-Term Countdown (8): Spend a Fear to activate after the Monarch’s desire for war is first revealed. When it triggers, the Monarch has a reason to rally the nation to war and the support to act on that reason. You gain 1d4 Fear.

description: An undead figure wearing a heavy leather coat, with searching eyes and a cruelly cut demeanor.
name: Mortal Hunter

features.name: Terrifying
features.description: When the Hunter makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Deathlock
features.description: Spend a Fear to curse a target within Very Close range with a necrotic Deathlock until the end of the scene. Attacks made by the Hunter against a Deathlocked target deal direct damage. The Hunter can only maintain one Deathlock at a time.

features.name: Inevitable Death
features.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

features.name: Rampage
features.description: Countdown (Loop 1d6). When the Hunter is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, move the Hunter in a straight line to a point within Far range and make an attack against all targets in their path. Targets the Hunter succeeds against take 2d8+2 physical damage.

description: A sturdy animated old-growth tree.
name: Oak Treant

features.name: Just a Tree
features.description: Before they make their first attack in a fight or after they become Hidden, the Treant is indistinguishable from other trees until they next act or a PC succeeds on an Instinct Roll to identify them.

features.name: Seed Barrage
features.description: Mark a Stress and make an attack against up to three targets within Close range, pummeling them with giant acorns. Targets the Treant succeeds against take 2d10+5 physical damage.

features.name: Take Root
features.description: Mark a Stress to Root the Treant in place. The Treant is Restrained while Rooted, and can end this effect instead of moving while they are spotlighted. While Rooted, the Treant has resistance to physical damage.

description: A towering immortal and incarnation of fate, cursed to only see bad outcomes.
name: Oracle Of Doom

features.name: Terrifying
features.description: When the Oracle makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Walls Closing In
features.description: When a creature rolls a failure while within Very Far range of the Oracle, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Pronounce Fate
features.description: Spend a Fear to present a target within Far range with a vision of their personal nightmare. The target must make a Knowledge Reaction Roll. On a failure, they lose all Hope and take 2d10+4 direct magic damage. On a success, they take half damage and lose a Hope.

features.name: Summon Tormentors
features.description: Once per day, spend 2 Fear to summon 2d4 Tier 2 or below Minions relevant to one of the PC’s personal nightmares. They appear at Close range relative to that PC.

features.name: Ominous Knowledge
features.description: When the Oracle sees a mortal creature, they instantly know one of their personal nightmares.

features.name: Vengeful Fate
features.description: When the Oracle marks HP from an attack within Very Close range, you can mark a Stress to knock the attacker back to Far range and deal 2d10+4 physical damage.

description: A chaotic mockery of life, constantly in flux.
name: Outer Realms Abomination

features.name: Chaotic Form
features.description: When the Abomination attacks, roll 2d4 and use the result as their attack modifier.

features.name: Disorienting Presence
features.description: When a target takes damage from the Abomination, they must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, they gain disadvantage on their next action roll and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Reality Quake
features.description: Spend a Fear to rattle the edges of reality within Far range of the Abomination. All targets within that area must succeed on a Knowledge Reaction Roll or become Unstuck from reality until the end of the scene. When an Unstuck target spends Hope or marks Armor Slots, HP, or Stress, they must double the amount spent or marked.

features.name: Fungal Form
features.description: When the Abomination takes damage, reduce it by 1d20. If the Abomination marks 1 or fewer Hit Points from a successful attack against them, you gain a Fear.

description: A shifting, formless mass seemingly made of chromatic light.
name: Outer Realms Corrupter

features.name: Will
features.description: When a PC takes damage from the Corrupter, they lose a Hope.

features.name: Disgorge Reality Flotsam
features.description: Mark a Stress to spew partially digested portions of consumed realities at all targets within Close range. Targets must succeed on a Knowledge Reaction Roll or mark 2 Stress.

description: A vaguely humanoid form stripped of memory and identity.
name: Outer Realms Thrall

features.name: Minion (13)
features.description: The Thrall is defeated when they take any damage. For every 13 damage a PC deals to the Thrall, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Outer Realm Thralls within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 11 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A towering gestalt of corpses moving as one, with torso-sized limbs and fists as large as a grown halfling.
name: Patchwork Zombie Hulk

features.name: Destructive
features.description: When the Zombie takes Major or greater damage, they mark an additional HP.

features.name: Flailing Limbs
features.description: When the Zombie makes a standard attack, they can attack all targets within Very Close range.

features.name: Another for the Pile
features.description: When the Zombie is within Very Close range of a corpse, they can incorporate it into themselves, clearing a HP and a Stress.

features.name: Tormented Screams
features.description: Mark a Stress to cause all PCs within Far range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail lose a Hope and you gain a Fear for each. Targets who succeed must mark a Stress.

description: A towering, muscular zombie with magically infused strength and skill.
name: Perfected Zombie

features.name: Terrifying
features.description: On successful attack, all PCs in Far range lose Hope and you gain Fear.

features.name: Fearsome Presence
features.description: PCs can’t spend Hope to use features against the Zombie.

features.name: Perfect Strike
features.description: Mark a Stress to attack all targets within Very Close range; on success, targets are Vulnerable until next rest.

features.name: Skilled Opportunist
features.description: When another adversary deals damage to target within Very Close range of Zombie, spend a Fear to add Zombie's standard attack damage to the damage roll.

description: A richly dressed and adorned aristocrat brimming with hubris.
name: Petty Noble

features.name: My Land, My Rules
features.description: All social actions made against the Noble on their land have disadvantage.

features.name: Guards, Seize Them!
features.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon 1d4 Bladed Guards, who appear at Far range to enforce the Noble’s will.

features.name: Exile
features.description: Spend a Fear and target a PC. The Noble proclaims that the target and their allies are exiled from the noble’s territory. While exiled, the target and their allies have disadvantage during social situations within the Noble’s domain.

description: A charismatic sea dog with an impressive hat, eager to raid and plunder.
name: Pirate Captain

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.description: When the Captain marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

features.name: Reinforcements
features.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon a Pirate Raiders Horde, which appears at Far range.

features.name: No Quarter
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target who has three or more Pirates within Melee range of them. The Captain leads the Pirates in hurling threats and promises of a watery grave. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target marks 1d4+1 Stress. On a success, they must mark a Stress.

features.name: Momentum
features.description: When the Captain makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

description: Seafaring scoundrels moving in a ravaging pack.
name: Pirate Raiders

features.name: Horde (1d4+1)
features.description: When the Raiders have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.description: When the Raiders mark 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

description: A thickly muscled and tattooed pirate with melon-sized fists.
name: Pirate Tough

features.name: Swashbuckler
features.description: When the Tough marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

features.name: Clear the Decks
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to move into Melee range of the target, dealing 3d4 physical damage and knocking the target back to Close range.

description: A moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.
name: Red Ooze

features.name: Creeping Fire
features.description: The Ooze can only move within Very Close range as their normal movement. They light any flammable object they touch on fire.

features.name: Ignite
features.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target takes 1d8 magic damage and is ignited until they’re extinguished with a successful Finesse Roll (14). While ignited, the target takes 1d4 magic damage when they make an action roll.

features.name: Split
features.description: When the Ooze has 3 or more HP marked, you can spend a Fear to split them into two Tiny Red Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

description: A decaying corpse ambling toward their prey.
name: Rotted Zombie

features.name: Minion (3)
features.description: The Zombie is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Zombie, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Rotted Zombies within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: A high-ranking courtier with the ear of the local nobility.
name: Royal Advisor

features.name: Devastating Retort
features.description: A PC who rolls less than 17 on an action roll targeting the Advisor must mark a Stress.

features.name: Bend Ears
features.description: Mark a Stress to influence an NPC within Melee range with whispered words. That target’s opinion on one matter shifts toward the Advisor’s preference unless it is in direct opposition to the target’s motives.

features.name: Scapegoat
features.description: Spend a Fear to convince a crowd or notable individual that one person or group is responsible for some problem facing the target. The target becomes hostile to the scapegoat until convinced of their innocence with a successful Presence Roll (17).

description: A clandestine leader with a direct channel to the Fallen Gods.
name: Secret-Keeper

features.name: Seize Your Moment
features.description: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight 1d4 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

features.name: Our Master’s Will
features.description: When you spotlight an ally within Far range, mark a Stress to gain a Fear.

features.name: Summoning Ritual
features.description: Countdown (6). When the Secret-Keeper is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When they mark HP, tick down this countdown by the number of HP marked. When it triggers, summon a Minor Demon who appears at Close range.

features.name: Fallen Hounds
features.description: Once per scene, when the Secret-Keeper marks 2 or more HP, you can mark a Stress to summon a Demonic Hound Pack, which appears at Close range and is immediately spotlighted.

description: An armed mercenary testing their luck.
name: Sellsword

features.name: Minion (4)
features.description: The Sellsword is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Sellsword, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
features.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Sellswords within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 3 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

description: An animated corpse that moves shakily, driven only by hunger.
name: Shambling Zombie

features.name: Too Many to Handle
features.description: When the Zombie is within Melee range of a creature and at least one other Zombie is within Close range, all attacks against that creature have advantage.

features.name: Horrifying
features.description: Targets who mark HP from the Zombie’s attacks must also mark a Stress.

description: A large aquatic predator, always on the move.
name: Shark

features.name: Terrifying
features.description: When the Shark makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

features.name: Rending Bite
features.description: When the Shark makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

features.name: Blood in the Water
features.description: When a creature within Close range of the Shark marks HP from another creature’s attack, you can mark a Stress to immediately spotlight the Shark, moving them into Melee range of the target and making a standard attack.

description: A half fish person with shimmering scales and an irresistible voice.
name: Siren

features.name: Captive Audience
features.description: If the Siren makes a standard attack against a target Entranced by their song, the attack deals 2d10+1 damage instead of their standard damage.

features.name: Enchanting Song
features.description: Spend a Fear to sing a song that affects all targets within Close range. Targets must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or become Entranced until they mark 2 Stress. Other Sirens within Close range of the target can mark a Stress to each add a +1 bonus to the Difficulty of the reaction roll. While Entranced, a target can’t act and is Vulnerable.

description: A fragile skeleton with a shortbow and arrows.
name: Skeleton Archer

features.name: Opportunist
features.description: When two or more adversaries are within Very Close range of a creature, all damage they each deal to that creature is doubled.

features.name: Deadly Shot
features.description: Make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Far range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 3d4+8 physical damage.

description: A clattering pile of bones.
name: Skeleton Dredge

features.name: Minion (4)
features.description: The Dredge is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Dredge, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

features.name: Group Attack
